Class CronExecution

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.emmanueltouzery.crony.CronExecution

  • public class CronExecution
extends Object
    Retrieve information regarding the execution dates of a cron specification.

      • getNextExecutionDates

        public static javaslang.collection.Stream<ZonedDateTime> getNextExecutionDates(Cron cron,
                                                                               ZonedDateTime base)
        Get an infinite stream of the next execution dates after a date you give for a cron specification. You can use Stream.take(long) to retrieve a limited number of elements.
        Parameters:
        cron - the cron specification
        base - the date to start from
        Returns:
        an infinite stream of upcoming execution dates.

        public static javaslang.collection.Stream<ZonedDateTime> getPreviousExecutionDates(Cron cron,

        Parameters:

        base - the date to start from
        Returns:
        an infinite stream of previous execution dates.

      • gapToClosestExecution

        public static Duration gapToClosestExecution(Cron cron,
                                             ZonedDateTime base)
        Calculates the gap between the date you give and the closest execution date for the cron specification you supply (either before or after the date you give). The calculated gap will always be positive. So for instance if the previous execution is 2 minutes before the date you give, and the next one is 2 hours after, the duration returned will be two minutes (not minus two minutes).
        Parameters:
        cron - the cron specification
        base - the date to consider
        Returns:
        the gap between the date you give and the closest execution time
